Module main
Package com.vtuberrush.src.managers

Class EnemyManager

java.lang.Object
com.vtuberrush.src.managers.EnemyManager
public class EnemyManager extends Object
Facilitates the rendering and pathfinding of enemies.
Version:
0.0.1-alpha.1
Author:
Gio Carlo Ciudadano

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemyManager

      public EnemyManager​(Playing playing, Flag start, Flag end)
      Initializes the list of enemies and enemy effects. Created when initializing the PLAYING game state.
      Parameters:
      playing - - Defines the specific instance of the scene where the unit manager is initialized.
      See Also:
      loadEffects(), loadEnemies()

  • Method Details

    • loadEffects

      public void loadEffects()
      Initializes the sprites used for enemy effects.

    • loadEnemies

      public void loadEnemies()
      Initializes the sprites used for enemies.

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Updates the movement and animation of all enemies.

    • draw

      public void draw​(Graphics graphics)
      Renders all enemies, enemy health bars, and enemy effects.
      Parameters:
      graphics - - Responsible for drawing objects to the screen.

    • addEnemy

      public void addEnemy​(int type)
      Adds a new enemy to the start flag depending on the passed enemy type.
      Called by the WaveManager when spawning new enemies in a wave.
      Parameters:
      type - - The type of enemy being added.

    • addGold

      public void addGold​(int type)
      Adds gold to the user depending on the passed enemy type.
      Called when an enemy is killed.
      Parameters:
      type - - The type of enemy being killed.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Clears all enemies in the field.
      Called during a game over or game complete condition.

    • getEnemies

      public ArrayList<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Returns a list of all spawnable enemies.

    • getRemainingEnemies

      public int getRemainingEnemies()
      Returns the number of enemies remaining on the field.
      Returns:
      remaining - The number of enemies remaining on the field.
